text: How is the data model of the ledger? For example, Fabric has a Key, with value and version, is the same in Sawtooth? Thanks

We’re working on the data model, so it is in flux. We have two main stores that are in memory. They are key-value stores but one can do lookups based on attributes on the value: sawtooth-core/validator/journal/object_store. For persistence we use a Python module named Shelve that stores binary files, but we are working on other implementations such as Lightning database.
<@U26PBUZRT> from a user's perspective, though, there are higher level data objects. Marketplace, for example, defines participants and asset classes.
